alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 26 at 3:54PM EDT until July 26 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... St. Clair County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 354 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rochester to St. Clair Shores to 6 miles east of Grosse Pointe, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Harsens Island around 415 PM EDT. Richmond and Algonac around 420 PM EDT. Marine City, Memphis and Emmett around 425 PM EDT. Marysville around 440 PM EDT. Port Huron around 445 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Anchorville, Adair, Rattle Run, Goodells, Smiths Creek, Fair Haven, Wadhams, Riley Center, Fort Gratiot and Allenton. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
